column5: Description
column11: Acceptance Criteria

column5: Design, print, and assemble all structural components of the 6-DoF arm using BambuLab printer.
Design and assemble the power system, motor drivers, encoders, and wiring harness.
Bring up SimpleFOC on ESP32: single motor, multi-motor, PID tuning, safety, and homing.
User-facing interfaces for manual joint control: serial CLI, web dashboard, and gamepad.
End-to-end integration testing, payload characterization, and documentation for MVP release.
Establish reliable high-speed communication between Raspberry Pi and ESP32, and set up RPi environment.
Set up high-speed camera, calibrate, implement color tracking, and estimate 3D target position.
Implement forward kinematics, IK solver, and workspace analysis for the 6-DoF arm.
Trajectory interpolation in joint and Cartesian space, collision avoidance, and real-time tracking loop.
End-to-end autonomous demos, monitoring dashboard, performance metrics, and final documentation.

column4: Parametric CAD model of all 6 joints
column5: As an engineer, I want a parametric CAD model of all 6 joints so that I can iterate on dimensions quickly.
column11:
* Full 6-DoF assembly in Fusion 360 / SolidWorks
* Each joint parameterized (length, bore, offset)
* BOM exported

column4: Bearing housings and shaft couplers for iPower GM4108
column5: As an engineer, I want bearing housings and shaft couplers designed for iPower GM4108 motors so that shafts are rigid and concentric.
column11:
* Shaft coupler fits 8mm motor shaft
* Bearing seat tolerances +/-0.1mm
* Test-fit print verified

column4: Stable base plate with mounting holes
column5: As an engineer, I want a stable base plate with mounting holes so the arm doesn't tip during operation.
column11:
* Base footprint >= 150x150mm
* M4 mounting holes on 100mm grid
* Weighted or bolt-down option

column5: As an engineer, I want a modular end-effector mount so I can swap grippers or tool heads later.
column11:
* Standard dovetail or bolt pattern
* Quick-release mechanism
* <= 50g added mass

column4: Optimized print orientation for all parts
column5: As an engineer, I want all parts printed on BambuLab with optimized orientation so that layer lines don't weaken critical joints.
column11:
* Print profiles documented (PLA/PETG, infill%, supports)
* Critical joints printed flat or with inserts
* Total print time < 30h

column5: As an engineer, I want an assembly guide with hardware BOM so that anyone can reproduce the build.
column11:
* Step-by-step photo assembly guide
* BOM with supplier links
* Fastener torque specs

column4: Power distribution board for all motors + ESP32
column5: As an engineer, I want a power distribution board that supplies 12V to all 6 motors and 3.3V to the ESP32 so that the system runs from a single PSU.
column11:
* Single 12V 10A+ PSU input
* Per-motor fusing or polyfuse
* 3.3V buck converter for ESP32
* Reverse polarity protection

column4: Current sensing on Joint 1 and Joint 2
column5: As an engineer, I want current sensing on at least Joint 1 and Joint 2 so I can detect stalls and overloads.
column11:
* INA219 or ACS712 per channel
* I2C readable from ESP32
* Alert threshold configurable

column5: As an engineer, I want each motor connected to a SimpleFOC-compatible driver so that FOC runs at >=10kHz PWM.
column11:
* 6 driver boards wired and tested
* PWM frequency verified >= 10kHz
* Heat sinks on FETs if needed

column5: As an engineer, I want magnetic encoders (AS5048A/AS5600) on each joint so that SimpleFOC has closed-loop position feedback.
column11:
* 6x encoders mounted and aligned
* SPI or I2C bus verified (no address conflicts)
* Resolution >= 14-bit

column4: Cable routing plan with strain relief
column5: As an engineer, I want a cable routing plan with strain relief so that wires don't snag or fatigue during arm motion.
column11:
* Cable channels in CAD
* JST connectors for quick disconnect
* Flex-rated wire for moving joints

column4: Open-loop voltage mode on single motor
column5: As an engineer, I want to spin a single iPower motor in open-loop voltage mode via SimpleFOC so that I verify driver + encoder wiring.
column11:
* Motor spins smoothly in open-loop
* No cogging or skipping
* Current draw < 1A at no-load

column4: Closed-loop angle control with PID tuning
column5: As an engineer, I want closed-loop angle control on a single motor with PID tuning so that I can hold a setpoint within +/-0.5 degrees.
column11:
* Angle mode with sensor feedback
* PID gains documented
* Step response < 200ms settle time
* Steady-state error < 0.5 degrees

column5: As an engineer, I want all 6 motors running closed-loop simultaneously on a single ESP32 so that the control loop stays above 1kHz.
column11:
* 6 motor instances initialized
* Loop frequency >= 1kHz measured
* No I2C/SPI bus contention
* If needed, dual-ESP32 with CAN bus

column5: As an engineer, I want software joint limits (min/max angle per joint) so the arm can't self-collide or over-extend.
column11:
* Configurable min/max per joint in code
* Motor stops smoothly at limit
* Limits survive reboot (stored in NVS)

column4: Homing sequence with limit switches or index pulses
column5: As an engineer, I want a homing sequence using limit switches or index pulses so that absolute position is known after power-on.
column11:
* Each joint homes to a known zero
* Homing speed is slow and safe
* Status LED indicates homing complete

column5: As an engineer, I want an emergency stop (hardware button + software watchdog) so the arm can be killed instantly.
column11:
* Physical E-stop button cuts motor power
* Software watchdog triggers if loop stalls > 50ms
* Watchdog logs fault reason to serial

column4: Serial command interface for joint angles
column5: As a user, I want to send target angles via serial commands (e.g., 'J1 45.0') so I can control each joint from a terminal.
column11:
* Parse 'Jn <angle>' commands
* Respond with current position
* Handle bad input gracefully

column4: STATUS command for all joint angles and currents
column5: As a user, I want a 'STATUS' command that prints all 6 joint angles and motor currents so I can monitor the arm state.
column11:
* Formatted table output
* Updates at <= 100ms if in stream mode
* Shows fault flags

column5: As a user, I want a simple web UI hosted on the ESP32 (WebSocket) with 6 sliders so I can move joints without a terminal.
column11:
* ESP32 serves HTML page via WiFi AP
* 6 sliders with degree labels
* Real-time position feedback on UI
* Latency < 50ms

column4: Save and replay joint poses (teach mode)
column5: As a user, I want to save and replay joint poses (teach mode) so I can record a sequence and play it back.
column11:
* 'Record Pose' button stores 6 angles
* 'Play Sequence' replays in order
* Adjustable playback speed
* Stored in ESP32 SPIFFS

column4: Bluetooth gamepad control for joint jogging
column5: As a user, I want to control the arm with a Bluetooth gamepad so I can jog joints intuitively.
column11:
* ESP32 BLE pairs with standard gamepad
* Stick axes map to joint velocity
* Deadzone and sensitivity configurable

column5: As an engineer, I want a full integration test checklist so I can verify the assembled arm meets MVP criteria.
column11:
* All 6 joints move to commanded angles
* Repeatability < 1 degree over 10 cycles
* No overheating after 30 min
* E-stop verified

column4: Max payload measurement at various extensions
column5: As an engineer, I want to measure the max payload at full extension so I can spec the arm for real tasks.
column11:
* Payload tested at 100%, 75%, 50% extension
* Motor current vs. load curve plotted
* Max safe payload documented

column4: GitHub repo with wiring diagrams, CAD, firmware, and setup guide
column5: As a contributor, I want a GitHub repo with wiring diagrams, CAD files, firmware, and setup instructions so others can replicate the build.
column11:
* README with overview and photos
* /cad, /firmware, /electronics folders
* Flashing instructions for ESP32
* License file (MIT/Apache)

column4: Serial protocol for >= 100Hz joint commands (RPi <-> ESP32)
column5: As an engineer, I want a serial (UART) or USB protocol between RPi and ESP32 so the Pi can send joint commands at >= 100Hz.
column11:
* Packet format defined (header, 6x float32, checksum)
* Roundtrip latency < 5ms
* Error recovery on dropped packets

column4: Joint state streaming from ESP32 to RPi
column5: As an engineer, I want the ESP32 to stream joint states back to the RPi so the IK solver has real-time feedback.
column11:
* Joint angles + velocities at 100Hz
* Timestamps synced
* Buffering handles jitter

column4: Reproducible RPi image with all dependencies
column5: As an engineer, I want a reproducible RPi image (Raspberry Pi OS Lite + deps) so any team member can flash and run.
column11:
* Ansible playbook or shell script
* Python 3.11+, OpenCV, NumPy pre-installed
* Auto-start service for arm controller

column5: As an engineer, I want the ArduCam configured to stream 200 FPS at a usable resolution (>= 320x240) so the vision pipeline has fast frames.
column11:
* 200 FPS verified with timestamp delta
* Resolution >= 320x240
* Exposure and gain tunable
* CSI or USB3 connection to RPi

column5: As an engineer, I want intrinsic camera calibration (checkerboard method) so pixel coordinates map accurately to world coordinates.
column11:
* Calibration matrix and distortion coefficients saved
* Reprojection error < 0.5px
* Calibration script in repo

column4: Real-time HSV color-based object detection at >= 100 FPS
column5: As a user, I want real-time color-based object detection (HSV thresholding) so the arm can track a colored ball at >= 100 FPS.
column11:
* HSV range configurable via UI or config file
* Centroid + bounding box output
* Handles partial occlusion
* Processing >= 100 FPS on RPi

column4: Mono 3D position estimation from known object size
column5: As an engineer, I want to estimate the 3D position of the tracked object from a single camera using known object size so the IK solver gets XYZ targets.
column11:
* Mono depth estimation from known object diameter
* Output: (X, Y, Z) in arm base frame
* Accuracy <= 10mm at 300mm range
* Hand-eye calibration completed

column4: 3D-printed camera mount with known transform to arm base
column5: As an engineer, I want a 3D-printed camera mount with known transform to the arm base so hand-eye calibration is repeatable.
column11:
* Rigid mount, no vibration
* Known (X, Y, Z, R, P, Y) offset to base
* Eye-to-hand or eye-in-hand config documented

column4: Forward kinematics validated against CAD model
column5: As an engineer, I want forward kinematics (DH parameter table) validated against the CAD model so FK matches physical geometry within 1mm.
column11:
* DH table for all 6 joints documented
* FK output vs. CAD measurement < 1mm error
* Python FK function unit-tested

column5: As an engineer, I want an analytical or numerical IK solver that computes joint angles for a target (X, Y, Z, Roll, Pitch, Yaw) in < 1ms.
column11:
* Solves for full 6-DoF pose
* Handles multiple solutions (elbow up/down)
* Returns closest solution to current pose
* Solve time < 1ms on RPi

column4: IK solver rejects unreachable targets gracefully
column5: As an engineer, I want the IK solver to reject unreachable targets gracefully so the arm doesn't attempt impossible poses.
column11:
* Workspace boundary check before solve
* Returns error code for out-of-reach
* Suggests nearest reachable point

column5: As an engineer, I want a visualization of the arm's reachable workspace so I can position objects within range.
column11:
* 3D point cloud of reachable positions
* Matplotlib or web-based visualization
* Color-coded by manipulability index

column5: As an engineer, I want trapezoidal velocity profile interpolation in joint space so movements are smooth and respect velocity limits.
column11:
* Configurable max velocity and acceleration per joint
* S-curve or trapezoidal profile
* Waypoint queue with blending

column5: As a user, I want the end-effector to move in a straight line in Cartesian space so the arm can follow a linear trajectory to the target.
column11:
* Linear interpolation in task space
* IK solved at each waypoint (>= 50 pts/sec)
* Singularity detection and avoidance

column5: As an engineer, I want basic self-collision checking so the arm doesn't crash into itself during planned moves.
column11:
* Simplified geometric model (cylinders per link)
* Collision check at each waypoint
* Path rejected if collision detected

column5: As a user, I want the arm to continuously follow a moving colored object in real-time so it tracks the ball smoothly.
column11:
* Vision -> IK -> Command pipeline at >= 30Hz
* Predictive filtering (Kalman or EMA)
* Smooth motion even with noisy detections
* Graceful stop when object lost

column5: As a user, I want the arm to autonomously pick up a colored object and place it at a target location so I can demo the full pipeline.
column11:
* Detects object -> plans path -> picks -> places
* Success rate >= 70% over 10 trials
* End-to-end latency < 3s

column4: RPi web dashboard with camera feed and IK overlay
column5: As a user, I want a web dashboard on the RPi showing camera feed, joint states, and IK target so I can monitor autonomous operation.
column11:
* Live camera stream with overlay
* Joint angle gauges
* IK target marker on video
* Mode selector (manual / track / auto)

column4: Logged performance metrics and analysis notebook
column5: As an engineer, I want logged metrics (tracking error, loop timing, success rate) so I can benchmark and improve the system.
column11:
* CSV logging of key metrics per run
* Tracking error (mm) histogram
* Loop timing statistics
* Dashboard or Jupyter notebook for analysis

column4: Full system documentation with demo videos
column5: As a contributor, I want full system documentation including vision pipeline, IK math, and demo videos so the project is presentable to investors or open-source community.
column11:
* Architecture diagram
* IK derivation document
* Demo video (60s) on YouTube/GitHub
* Setup guide for Phase 2 hardware
